name: Machine Learning in Action - in F#
body:
### Project objectives.
This project is inspired by the book "[Machine Learning in Action](http://www.manning.com/pharrington/)", by Peter Harrington, published at Manning Publications Co. The project objective is to convert the book samples from Python to F#.

### Part 1: Classification
* Chapter 2: k-Nearest Neighbors, [Part 1](http://clear-lines.com/blog/post/Nearest-Neighbor-Classification-part-1.aspx) and [Part 2](http://clear-lines.com/blog/post/Nearest-Neighbor-Classification-Part-2.aspx)
* Chapter 3: [Decision Trees](http://clear-lines.com/blog/post/Decision-Tree-classification.aspx)
* Chapter 4: [Naive Bayes classification](http://clear-lines.com/blog/post/Naive-Bayes-Classification.aspx)
* Chapter 5: [Logistic regression](http://clear-lines.com/blog/post/Logistic-Regression.aspx)
* Chapter 6: Support Vector Machines: [part 1](http://clear-lines.com/blog/post/Support-Vector-Machine-in-FSharp-work-in-progress.aspx) (naive implementation), [part 2](http://clear-lines.com/blog/post/Support-Vector-Machine-in-FSharp.aspx) (SMO, Kernels). _(currently works, but needs some performance tuning)._
* Chapter 7: [AdaBoost](http://clear-lines.com/blog/post/AdaBoost-classifier-in-FSharp.aspx)

### Part 3: Unsupervised Learning
* Chapter 10: K-means clustering. [part 1](http://clear-lines.com/blog/post/K-Means-Clustering-in-FSharp.aspx).

### Part 4: Additional Tools
* Chapter 14: Simplifying data with the singular value decomposition. [Part 1](http://www.clear-lines.com/blog/post/Simplify-data-with-SVD-and-MathNET-in-FSharp.aspx).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
